text: Jews survived all the defeats, expulsions, persecutions and pogroms, the centuries in which they were regarded as a pariah people, even the Holocaust itself, because they never gave up the faith that one day they would be free to live as Jews without fear.

author: Debbie Ford
text: Self-acknowledgment boosts your emotional and spiritual immunity, giving you the strength you need to release the past and rise above fear, doubt or resignation.

author: Erik Paulsen
text: Our democracy is predicated on the belief that our government should be accessible by the people. We cannot allow ourselves to give in to fear or shy away from interacting with the public.

author: Rachel Nichols
text: Sometimes, when full and in fear that I will continue to eat unwanted food just because it's staring at me, I will place my napkin over the remaining portion. This is what I frequently refer to as a 'food funeral.'

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
text: There are only two forces that unite men - fear and interest.

author: Peter McWilliams
text: To overcome a fear, here's all you have to do: realize the fear is there, and do the action you fear anyway.

author: Mel Brooks
text: Everything we do in life is based on fear, especially love.

text: When someone fears losing your affection, he or she will strive to keep it. Perhaps you have strived to keep someone's affection, too. Fear of loss is not love.

author: Robert Dallek
text: In his State of the Union speech in January 1941, President Franklin Roosevelt declared America's commitment to Four Freedoms in the struggle against Nazi totalitarianism. Among them was the freedom from fear.

author: Aeschylus
text: Excessive fear is always powerless.

text: There is no city or country in the world where women and girls live free of the fear of violence. No leader can claim: 'this is not happening in my backyard.'

text: My big fear is that I'll put down so many people, I'll have to leave show biz.

author: Trevor McDonald
text: I am actually a terrible coward. Fear is a constant fact of my life.

author: Michael O'Donoghue
text: Insects are my secret fear. That's what terrifies me more than anything - insects.

text: I do not fear Satan half so much as I fear those who fear him.

text: When you combine boring with fear, you have fun.

author: Warren Farrell
text: The only men who aren't in fear of women's reactions are usually men who aren't born or who are dead.

author: Mary Roach
text: I don't fear death so much as I fear its prologues: loneliness, decrepitude, pain, debilitation, depression, senility. After a few years of those, I imagine death presents like a holiday at the beach.

author: Jodie Whittaker
text: I've never been mugged, never really experienced street fear. In fact, I'm the one who gets into arguments because I don't keep my mouth shut.

author: Paramahansa Yogananda
text: It is wisest to be impartial. If you have health, but are attached to it, you will always be afraid of losing it. And if you fear that loss, but become ill, you will suffer. Why not remain forever joyful in the Self?

author: Venus Williams
text: You have to let fear go. Another lesson is you just have to believe in yourself; you just have to. There's no way around it. No matter how things are stacked against you, you just have to every time.

text: I'm a Midwestern girl, born and bred. It's harder for some of us to write about things closer to home. It's not so much a fear of telling the truth but wanting to do it justice.

text: Well, the most terrible fear that anybody should have is not war, is not a disease, not cancer or heart problems or food poisoning - it's a man or a woman without a sense of humor.

author: Lactantius

author: Lewis Black
text: I'm constantly in fear of having a stroke.

author: Leonardo da Vinci

author: Robert Webb
text: UKIP trades in the language of fear and division; it seeks power in order to reject responsibility.

author: Joel Barlow

author: Tom Watson

author: Terence Fisher

author: Dan Quisenberry

author: Moby
text: I think a lot of self-importance is a product of fear. And fear, living in sort of an un-self-examined fear-based life, tends to lead to narcissism and self-importance.

author: Lobsang Tenzin
text: No one can avoid death; it is inevitable. Therefore, I should create in my mind a kind of willingness and accepting for that event without any fear.

author: Heath Ledger
text: I like to do something I fear.

author: Niall Ferguson
text: The great thing about behavioural psychology and economics is that they help us to see that there are actually pretty good reasons why human beings swing from greed to fear, and why we're not really calculating machines or utility-maximisers.

author: Alexander Payne
text: The biggest fear I have is to die with regrets, and of course that will come true.

author: Penelope Cruz
text: I am living for every day and trying to have less fear, less worry. But I have always worried about everything; it's in my nature. It's the thing that makes me suffer the most.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: The thing we fear we bring to pass.

author: Oliver Joseph Lodge
text: Death is not a word to fear, any more than birth is.

text: I find that the prejudice in this country to color is very great, and I sometimes fear that it is on the increase.

author: Greg Kinnear
text: I find fear is a great motivator to work hard.

author: Fabrizio Moreira

text: Fear generates anger, and fear generates violence, and those were part of what built the Saudi state.

author: Kate Upton
text: I have a paralyzing fear of snakes.

author: Sylvia Browne

author: Andrew Weil
text: Fear and greed are potent motivators. When both of these forces push in the same direction, virtually no human being can resist.

author: Andy Kindler
text: I feel completely fearless when I'm on stage. And also totally fearful. There's the fear that I'm not making a very smart career move sometimes, but there's the stronger belief that these things need to be said.

author: Livy
text: Under the influence of fear, which always leads men to take a pessimistic view of things, they magnified their enemies' resources, and minimized their own.

author: Thomas Hardy
text: Fear is the mother of foresight.

author: William Hurt
text: When you are a kid, you are beset by fears, and you think, 'I'll solve the fear by living forever and becoming a movie star.'

author: Antonio Tabucchi
text: Like a blazing comet, I've traversed infinite nights, interstellar spaces of the imagination, voluptuousness and fear.

author: Dan Savage
text: A huge part of what animates homophobia among young people is paranoia and fear of their own capacity to be gay themselves.

author: Robert Falcon Scott
text: Hunger and fear are the only realities in dog life: an empty stomach makes a fierce dog.

author: Albert Einstein
text: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.

author: Byron Howard
text: It's tough sometimes for groups of people and animals to let go of that fear that can so easily bubble back up to the surface.

author: Marilyn Manson

author: David Brainerd
text: I have withstood the power of convictions a long time; and therefore I fear I shall be finally left of God.

text: Fear has nothing to do with cowardice. A fellow is only yellow when he lets his fear make him quit.

author: Alec Berg
text: I have enough motivation just not looking like an idiot on national television. The fear of disappointing people is certainly higher.

text: Exactly Straight women who surround themselves only with gay men or white people who refuse any other race into their circles are unhealthy and it has more to do with one's individual fear and individual closets.

text: I fear God never showed mercy to one so vile as I.

text: The gospel frees us to confess our sins without fear of condemnation.

text: Take responsibility and make a relationship the best it can be. We're all afraid of being hurt. Get rid of that fear. Be in the moment and enjoy the relationship - or you'll ruin it.

text: The gunner's mate came up and started breaking the locks on the ammunition. Everything was locked up for fear that someone might go in there with a cigarette or something.

text: Everyone believes very easily whatever they fear or desire.

author: John Wesley
text: I have not that joy in the Holy Ghost, no settled, lasting joy; nor have I such a peace as excludes the possibility either of fear or doubt.

author: Richard Dawkins
text: I sympathize with politicians who have to watch every syllable they utter for fear it will be misused by somebody with an agenda.
